title: Authors and Citation
text: Valerio Gherardi. Author, maintainer. Pablo Amador. Author. Andreu Rico. Reviewer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gherardi V, Amador P (2024). erahumed: ERAHUMED Data Analysis Visualization. R package version 0.8.1.9000, https://erahumed.github.io/erahumed/, https://github.com/erahumed/erahumed.
code: @Manual{,   title = {erahumed: ERAHUMED Data Analysis and Visualization},   author = {Valerio Gherardi and Pablo Amador},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.8.1.9000, https://erahumed.github.io/erahumed/},   url = {https://github.com/erahumed/erahumed}, }

title: ERAHUMED Data Analysis and Visualization
text: erahumed R package provides infrastructure ERAHUMED Decision Support System (DSS), consists : Data. inputs DSS packaged R data.frames imported erahumed. Analysis. entire modeling pipeline implemented R functions. Visualization. model outputs R objects methods data exploration visualization. Interactive Interface. graphical interface implemented Shiny application, also bundled package.

title: ERAHUMED Data Analysis and Visualization
text: can install latest release erahumed Github, running following command local R session: want development version (notice: may unstable), simply omit @*release reference, :
code: remotes::install_github("erahumed/erahumed@*release") remotes::install_github("erahumed/erahumed")  # development version

title: ERAHUMED Data Analysis and Visualization
text: graphical interface ERAHUMED DSS can accessed following R command: open DSS dashboard default browser, can explore model outputs user friendly manner.
code: erahumed::launch_app()

what: Example 2: command line interface to the models
title: ERAHUMED Data Analysis and Visualization
text: following example illustrates workflow manually running ERAHUMED model chain, extracting outputs various model components. pipeline always starts initializing new ERAHUMED model, via: main abstraction erahumed uses collect various components involved modeling chain DSS, initially blank. Next, populate model layers, achieved set compute_*() functions: compute_inp() - INPut data. compute_hba() - Hydrological Balance Albufera lake. compute_hbp() - Hydrological Balance rice Paddy clusters. compute_ca() - Chemical Applications. compute_ct() - Chemical Transport. instance, can compute first two layers default arguments (.e. default input data parameters hydrological balance computation) follows: can extract inspect model components illustrated following examples: Components plot methods can help data exploration: (output interactive plot, shown . Try !) Extracting component computed yet yields NULL result, e.g.: attempt compute downstream component whose dependencies defined yet, get informative error. example: Also, computing component erases output downstream dependencies (): order model components list logical one. component depends previous ones (referred “upstream”), dependency subsequent ones (referred “downstream”).
code: library(erahumed) model <- erahumed_model() model #> An ERAHUMED model. #> Calculated components:  None model <- model |> compute_inp() |> compute_hba() model #> An ERAHUMED model. #> Calculated components:  inp, hba hba(model)  # Extract the HBA model component #> An ERAHUMED HBA model component. #>  #> Output columns: level, precipitation_mm, evapotranspiration_mm, date, is_imputed_level, is_imputed_outflow, volume, volume_change, volume_change_petp, outflow_pujol, outflow_perellonet, outflow_perello, outflow_extra, outflow_total, inflow_total, residence_time_days hba(model) |>    component_output() |>  # Get output data.frame   tibble::as_tibble()    # Just for pretty printing #> # A tibble: 6,139 × 16 #>    level precipitation_mm evapotranspiration_mm date       is_imputed_level #>    <dbl>   <dbl>                 <dbl> <date>     <lgl>            #>  1 0.372     8.2                  0.54 2005-12-20 FALSE            #>  2 0.373     0.2                  0.65 2005-12-21 FALSE            #>  3 0.368     0.2                  0.62 2005-12-22 FALSE            #>  4 0.366     0.2                  1.02 2005-12-23 FALSE            #>  5 0.367     0                    0.59 2005-12-24 FALSE            #>  6 0.363     0.2                  0.86 2005-12-25 FALSE            #>  7 0.357     0.2                  0.63 2005-12-26 FALSE            #>  8 0.370     0                    1.96 2005-12-27 FALSE            #>  9 0.346     0                    0.95 2005-12-28 FALSE            #> 10 0.347     0                    1.37 2005-12-29 FALSE            #> # ℹ 6,129 more rows #> # ℹ 11 more variables: is_imputed_outflow <lgl>, volume <dbl>, #> #   volume_change <dbl>, volume_change_petp <dbl>, outflow_pujol <dbl>, #> #   outflow_perellonet <dbl>, outflow_perello <dbl>, outflow_extra <dbl>, #> #   outflow_total <dbl>, inflow_total <dbl>, residence_time_days <dbl> plot(hba(model), variable = "outflow_total") hbp(model) #> NULL compute_ca(model) #> Error in doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler): Upstream component 'hbp' of model must be computed first. compute_inp(model) |> hba() #> NULL model <- compute_inp(model) model #> An ERAHUMED model. #> Calculated components:  inp

title: ERAHUMED Data Analysis and Visualization
text: issues running erahumed want suggest improvement, please file issue Github. internal documentation, aimed potential contributors project, available Github Wiki.

title: Albufera Chemical Application Schedules — albufera_ca_schedules
text: Data application schedules chemicals used rice paddies Albufera National Park.

title: Albufera Chemical Application Schedules — albufera_ca_schedules
code: albufera_ca_schedules

title: Albufera Chemical Application Schedules — albufera_ca_schedules
text: dataset one row per chemical scheduled application given rice variety, following columns: day numeric. Scheduled day, counted starting sowing day, application consideration. rice_variety character. Rice variety specific application. chemical character. Name applied chemical. kg_per_ha numeric. Amount chemical applied, kilograms per hectare. application_type either "ground" "aerial". Application mode chemical rice paddies.

title: Albufera Chemical Application Schedules — albufera_ca_schedules
text: TODO #68

title: Albufera Rice Paddy Clusters — albufera_clusters
text: Datasets containing information various paddy clusters. TODO: Document clusters defined? #52

title: Albufera Rice Paddy Clusters — albufera_clusters
code: albufera_clusters  albufera_cluster_geometries

title: Albufera Rice Paddy Clusters — albufera_clusters
text: data frame one row per cluster, following columns: cluster_id character. Unique identifier cluster. ditch character. Ditch cluster pertains. area numeric. Area (squared meters) cluster. tancat logical. Whether cluster "tancat". rice_variety character. Variety rice planted cluster. case factor. ...?

title: Albufera Rice Paddy Clusters — albufera_clusters
text: data frame one row per cluster, columns: cluster_id character. Unique identifier cluster. geometry vector class sfc_MULTIPOLYGON.

title: Albufera Rice Paddy Clusters — albufera_clusters
text: datasets cardinality (one row per cluster), separated merely efficiency reasons. can joined using common cluster_id key column.

title: Albufera Management Data — albufera_management
text: Data management schedules rice paddies Albufera National Park. Contains information irrigation, draining water level paddies day year.

title: Albufera Management Data — albufera_management
code: albufera_management

title: Albufera Management Data — albufera_management
text: dataset one row per day year combinations categorical variables tancat variety. columns following: mm numeric. Month year (1 = January, 2 = February, etc.). dd numeric. Day month. tancat logical. Whether paddy "tancat" . variety character. Variety rice planted paddy consideration. sowing logical. Whether mm dd correspond sowing day. irrigation logical. Whether paddy scheduled irrigated day. draining logical. Whether paddy scheduled drained day. height_cm numeric. Water level paddy.

title: Albufera Management Data — albufera_management
text: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.scitotenv.2023.163018

title: Albufera Outflows Daily Data — albufera_outflows
text: Data continuous measurements outflow rates lake level "Confederación Hidrográfica del Júcar" (CHJ). original data several missing entries, imputed dataset using approach based GAMs. TODO: Document imputation approach used . #51

title: Albufera Outflows Daily Data — albufera_outflows
code: albufera_outflows

title: Albufera Outflows Daily Data — albufera_outflows
text: dataframes following columns: date Date measurement level Lake level (meters sea level) outflow_pujol Outflow Pujol (meters cube per second) outflow_perellonet Outflow Perellonet (meters cube per second) outflow_perello Outflow Perello (meters cube per second) is_imputed_level Whether level value imputed. is_imputed_outflow Whether () outflows imputed.

title: Albufera Outflows Daily Data — albufera_outflows
text: https://aps.chj.es/

title: Albufera Weather Daily Data — albufera_weather
text: TODO #50

title: Albufera Weather Daily Data — albufera_weather
code: albufera_weather

title: Albufera Weather Daily Data — albufera_weather
text: data frame 8552 rows 3 columns: date Date measurement temperature_ave Average temperature (TODO #50). temperature_min Minimum temperature. temperature_max Maximum temperature. precipitation_mm Daily precipitation millimiters. evapotranspiration_mm Daily evapotranspiration millimiters.

title: Albufera Weather Daily Data — albufera_weather
text: TODO #50

title: CA: Chemical Applications — ca
text: model component simulates application chemicals rice paddy clusters, based previously computed simulation local hydrological balance. result set time series applied doses, one applied chemical. modeling layer requires hbp component model pre-computed.

title: CA: Chemical Applications — ca
code: ca(model)  compute_ca(model, ca_schedules_df = erahumed::albufera_ca_schedules)

title: CA: Chemical Applications — ca
text: model object class erahumed_model, pre-computed hbp component (.e. hbp(model) NULL). ca_schedules_df data.frame following template albufera_ca_schedules. row data.frame corresponds scheduled application. semantics columns albufera_ca_schedules.

title: CA: Chemical Applications — ca
text: Objects class erahumed_model erahumed_ca, compute_ca() ca() respectively.

title: CA: Chemical Applications — ca
text: output data.frame extends output underlying hbp layer, preserving cardinality (one row per cluster per day). additional columns, named chemicals appearing ca_schedules_df, provide time series applied doses, expressed kilograms.

title: CA: Chemical Applications — ca
text: Pablo Amador Crespo, Valerio Gherardi

title: Extract model component outputs — component_output
text: Extracts output data.frame erahumed_model_component.

title: Extract model component outputs — component_output
code: component_output(object, ...)  # S3 method for class 'erahumed_model_component' component_output(object, ...)  # S3 method for class 'erahumed_model' component_output(object, component, ...)

title: Extract model component outputs — component_output
text: object object component output extracted (see available methods). ... arguments passed methods. component string. Name component whose output data.frame extracted.

title: Extract model component outputs — component_output
text: data.frame.

title: Extract model component outputs — component_output
text: Valerio Gherardi

title: CT: Chemical Transport — ct
text: model component computes evolution chemicals applied rice paddy clusters, based previously computed simulations hydrological balance chemicals application. result set time series chemical masses, one applied chemical three compartments: foliage, water sediment. modeling layer requires ca component model pre-computed.

title: CT: Chemical Transport — ct
code: ct(model)  compute_ct(   model,   drift = 0,   covmax = 0.5,   jgrow = 152,   SNK = 0,   dact_m = 0.1,   css_ppm = 50,   bd_g_cm3 = 1.5,   qseep_m_day = 0,   wilting = 0.24,   fc = 0.35 )

title: CT: Chemical Transport — ct
text: model object class erahumed_model, pre-computed ca component (.e. ca(model) NULL). drift number 0 1. Percentage chemical applications lost drift. covmax number 0 1. Interception potential foliage crop maturation. jgrow positive integer. Length (days) crop maturation cycle. SNK number 0 1. (TODO). dact_m positive number. Active sediment layer depth, expressed meters. css_ppm positive number. Suspended sediment concentration, expressed parts per million. bd_g_cm3 positive number. Bulk density sediment, expressed grams per cubic centimeter. qseep_m_day positive number. Seepage rate, expressed meters per day. wilting number 0 1. Wilting point. fc number 0 1. Field capacity.

title: CT: Chemical Transport — ct
text: Objects class erahumed_model erahumed_ct, compute_ct() ct() respectively.

title: CT: Chemical Transport — ct
text: TBD.

title: CT: Chemical Transport — ct
text: Pablo Amador Crespo, Valerio Gherardi

title: Initialize an ERAHUMED model — erahumed_model
text: Initializes ERAHUMED model. starting point ERAHUMED model chain, whose computations performed compute_*() functions. See erahumed_modeling_interface details.

title: Initialize an ERAHUMED model — erahumed_model
code: erahumed_model()

title: Initialize an ERAHUMED model — erahumed_model
text: object class erahumed_model, represents blank ERAHUMED model (model component computed yet).

title: Initialize an ERAHUMED model — erahumed_model
text: Valerio Gherardi

title: Initialize an ERAHUMED model — erahumed_model
code: m <- erahumed_model() m #> An ERAHUMED model. #> Calculated components:  None

title: ERAHUMED modeling interface — erahumed_modeling_interface
text: programming interface {erahumed} package reflects sequential structure ERAHUMED modeling chain. step sequence referred across documentation model "component" (, sometimes, informally modeling "layer"). documentation page focuses describing set abstractions provided {erahumed} deal sequential modeling model components. first abstraction provided erahumed_model objects. objects, technically implemented S3 classes, simple containers model components - , erahumed_model list stores sequence model components. way components model populated described subsequently. define following model components, whose technical implementation discussed extensively linked documentation pages: inp: INPut data. hba: Hydrological Balance Albufera lake. hbp: Hydrological Balance rice Paddy clusters. ca: Chemical Applications. order model components list logical one. component depends previous ones (referred "upstream"), dependency subsequent ones (referred "downstream"). components associated: compute_*() function, takes erahumed_model input returns model desired component computed top output. extractor function form *() (asterisk standing actual component name), extracts desired component erahumed_model. S3 class following naming scheme erahumed_*, inherits erahumed_model_component, ad-hoc print plot methods. Components can re-computed (, input model compute_*()) can previous computation components. case, order avoid confusing results, existing downstream dependency component recomputed erased output model, must recomputed required. example code illustrates typical operations model components,

title: ERAHUMED modeling interface — erahumed_modeling_interface
text: Valerio Gherardi

title: ERAHUMED modeling interface — erahumed_modeling_interface
code: ### Computation workflow m <- erahumed_model()  # Initialize a blank model  m <- m |> compute_inp() |> compute_hba()  # Compute INP and HBA components  m #> An ERAHUMED model. #> Calculated components:  inp, hba inp(m) #> An ERAHUMED INP model component. #>  #> Output columns: date, level, outflow_pujol, outflow_perellonet, outflow_perello, is_imputed_level, is_imputed_outflow, temperature_ave, temperature_min, temperature_max, precipitation_mm, evapotranspiration_mm hba(m) #> An ERAHUMED HBA model component. #>  #> Output columns: level, precipitation_mm, evapotranspiration_mm, date, is_imputed_level, is_imputed_outflow, volume, volume_change, volume_change_petp, outflow_pujol, outflow_perellonet, outflow_perello, outflow_extra, outflow_total, inflow_total, residence_time_days hbp(m)  # NULL because not yet computed #> NULL  m <- m |> compute_inp()  # Recompute INP layer hba(m)  # NULL because of previous line #> NULL  # The code below results in an error, because the HBP component depends # on the HBA component, which is still NULL (see above). if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ compute_hbp(m) } # }  ### Extracting and plotting outputs m <- m |> compute_inp() |> compute_hba()  component_output(inp(m)) |> head()  # 'erahumed_model_component' method #>         date     level outflow_pujol outflow_perellonet outflow_perello #> 1 2005-12-20 0.3725000      5.739292           2.919471        2.785127 #> 2 2005-12-21 0.3726458      5.901080           3.140746        2.919733 #> 3 2005-12-22 0.3683833      3.877427           2.500297        2.075301 #> 4 2005-12-23 0.3662375      5.410336           3.180986        2.763805 #> 5 2005-12-24 0.3667417      1.055759           1.578490        1.226585 #> 6 2005-12-25 0.3634917      6.922879           3.786494        3.249450 #>   is_imputed_level is_imputed_outflow temperature_ave temperature_min #> 1            FALSE               TRUE            9.06            7.55 #> 2            FALSE               TRUE            8.49            1.44 #> 3            FALSE               TRUE            5.28           -0.43 #> 4            FALSE               TRUE            6.60            1.10 #> 5            FALSE               TRUE            6.21            0.37 #> 6            FALSE               TRUE            8.35            1.10 #>   temperature_max precipitation_mm evapotranspiration_mm #> 1            9.94              8.2                  0.54 #> 2           13.12              0.2                  0.65 #> 3           13.92              0.2                  0.62 #> 4           15.77              0.2                  1.02 #> 5           13.12              0.0                  0.59 #> 6           17.90              0.2                  0.86 component_output(m, "hba") |> head()  # 'erahumed_model' method #>       level precipitation_mm evapotranspiration_mm       date is_imputed_level #> 1 0.3725000              8.2                  0.54 2005-12-20            FALSE #> 2 0.3726458              0.2                  0.65 2005-12-21            FALSE #> 3 0.3683833              0.2                  0.62 2005-12-22            FALSE #> 4 0.3662375              0.2                  1.02 2005-12-23            FALSE #> 5 0.3667417              0.0                  0.59 2005-12-24            FALSE #> 6 0.3634917              0.2                  0.86 2005-12-25            FALSE #>   is_imputed_outflow   volume volume_change volume_change_petp outflow_pujol #> 1               TRUE 25558393      3450.081          893796.84      5.739292 #> 2               TRUE 25561843   -100840.946          -28739.48      5.901080 #> 3               TRUE 25461002    -50765.481          -26358.65      3.877427 #> 4               TRUE 25410237     11927.424          -58103.05      5.410336 #> 5               TRUE 25422164    -76887.525          -46822.99      1.055759 #> 6               TRUE 25345277   -157323.705          -45405.29      6.922879 #>   outflow_perellonet outflow_perello outflow_extra outflow_total inflow_total #> 1           2.919471        2.785127             0     11.443889     1.138950 #> 2           3.140746        2.919733             0     11.961558    11.127050 #> 3           2.500297        2.075301             0      8.453025     8.170539 #> 4           3.180986        2.763805             0     11.355127    12.165665 #> 5           1.578490        1.226585             0      3.860835     3.512866 #> 6           3.786494        3.249450             0     13.958823    12.663471 #>   residence_time_days #> 1            21.01040 #> 2            20.97162 #> 3            20.97415 #> 4            20.92734 #> 5            20.92255 #> 6            20.86515  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Returns an interactive plotly plot, run manually. plot(hba(m), variable = "outflow_total") } # }

what: HBA: Hydrological Balance of the Albufera Lake — hba
title: HBA: Hydrological Balance of the Albufera Lake — hba
text: model component completes partial hydrological balance information provided input data, computing total inflow Albufera lake, well , relevant, amount unaccounted outflow - usually attributed tancats suck water lake. second modeling layer, requires inp component model previously defined.

title: HBA: Hydrological Balance of the Albufera Lake — hba
code: hba(model)  compute_hba(   model,   storage_curve = function(level) 16.7459 * 1e+06 + level * 23.6577 * 1e+06,   petp_function = function(p, etp) 114.225826072 * 1000 * p - 79.360993685 * 1000 * etp )

title: HBA: Hydrological Balance of the Albufera Lake — hba
text: model object class erahumed_model, pre-computed inp component (.e. inp(model) NULL). storage_curve function takes numeric vector input, returns numeric vector length. Function converts lake levels lake volumes. petp_function function takes two numeric vectors common length inputs, returns numeric vector length. Function converts precipitation evapotranspiration values (assumed expressed millimiters) overall volume change ( cube meters inputs given expected units).

title: HBA: Hydrological Balance of the Albufera Lake — hba
text: Objects class erahumed_model erahumed_hba, compute_hba() hba() respectively.

title: HBA: Hydrological Balance of the Albufera Lake — hba
text: numeric inputs linear storage curve taken CHJ report Modelo de seguimiento de l’Albufera de Valencia con AQUATOOLDMA.. values used arguments petp_function() calculated package authors, correspond total study area (surface_P) flooded surface (surface_ETP). output data.frame calculated HBA component contains copy input data, well following additional columns: volume Volume time series, obtained storage curve. volume_change Differenced time series volume. \(n\)-th given \(\Delta V _n \equiv V_{n+1}-V_n\), \(V_n\) volume time step \(n\). petp_change Time series. amount \(\Delta V _n ^\text{P-ETP}\) volume change due precipitation evapotranspiration, obtained P-ETP surface. outflow_total Time series total outflows, measured cube meters per second. sum \(\sum _i O_i\) time series passed outflows argument, plus extra term \(\delta O\) unaccounted outflow. correction term defined \(\delta O = \frac{\Delta V _n - \Delta V _n ^\text{P-ETP}}{24 \times 60 \times 60} -\sum _i O_i\) chosen way ensure total inflow always non-negative. outflow_extra Time series. unaccounted outflow term \(\delta O\) described . inflow_total Time serie total inflows, cube meters per second. computed \(= \sum _{} O_i + \delta O + \frac{\Delta V _n - \Delta V _n ^\text{P-ETP}}{24 \times 60 \times 60}\). residence_time_days. Residence time, modeled hba_residence_time.

title: HBA: Hydrological Balance of the Albufera Lake — hba
text: Pablo Amador Crespo, Valerio Gherardi

title: Residence Time — hba_residence_time
text: N.B.:: function one used internally hba compute residence times, directly exported {erahumed}. Computes residence times \(t = \overline{\text{Volume}} / \overline{\text{Outflow}} \), \(\overline {\cdot}\) denotes (symmetric) moving average.

title: Residence Time — hba_residence_time
code: hba_residence_time(volume, outflow_total, k = 61, units = c("days", "seconds"))

title: Residence Time — hba_residence_time
text: volume numeric vector. Time series volumes \(\text{m}^3\). outflow_total numeric vector. Time series total outflow \(\text{m}^3 / \text{s}\). k positive integer. Size window moving average. default order magnitude actual residence time Albufera Lake. units either "days" "seconds". Units measure returned time series.

title: Residence Time — hba_residence_time
text: numeric vector. Time series residence times, units measure specified units argument (assuming volume total_inflow provided correct units).

title: Residence Time — hba_residence_time
text: Pablo Amador Crespo, Valerio Gherardi

what: HBP: Hydrological Balance of rice Paddies — hbp
title: HBP: Hydrological Balance of rice Paddies — hbp
text: model component performs simulation hydrological balance daily data rice paddies Albufera National Park, provides synthetic dataset daily inflows, outflows average water levels rice paddy. inputs simulation : previously calculated hydrological balance Albufera lake. geographical subdivision Albufera National Park "clusters" rice paddies, definite rice variety, whose waters flow ditch. yearly ideal schedule irrigation draining, corresponding expected water levels cluster day year. modeling layer requires hba component model pre-computed.

title: HBP: Hydrological Balance of rice Paddies — hbp
code: hbp(model)  compute_hbp(   model,   management_df = erahumed::albufera_management,   clusters_df = erahumed::albufera_clusters,   ideal_flow_rate_cm = 5,   height_thresh_cm = 2 )

title: HBP: Hydrological Balance of rice Paddies — hbp
text: model object class erahumed_model, pre-computed hba component (.e. hba(model) NULL). management_df data.frame provides yearly schedule irrigation draining, strictly follows template albufera_management. clusters_df data.frame contains definition rice paddy clusters. strictly follow template albufera_clusters, fact unlikely user want change input (TODO #47). ideal_flow_rate_cm positive number. Ideal inflow/outflow cluster, days cluster scheduled flux (.e. simultaneously irrigated drained) Expressed centimeters per day. height_thresh_cm positive number. Height threshold water levels, cluster considered emptied.

title: HBP: Hydrological Balance of rice Paddies — hbp
text: Objects class erahumed_model erahumed_hbp, compute_hbp() hbp() respectively.

title: HBP: Hydrological Balance of rice Paddies — hbp
text: TODO: #64, plus detailed information structure management_df (perhaps also clusters_df, depending decision taken regarding #47).

title: HBP: Hydrological Balance of rice Paddies — hbp
text: Pablo Amador Crespo, Valerio Gherardi

title: INP: Input data — inp
text: model component purpose collect observational (, potentially, synthetic) data used algorithms ERAHUMED decision support system. first layer modeling chain upstream dependence.

title: INP: Input data — inp
code: inp(model)  compute_inp(   model,   outflows_df = erahumed::albufera_outflows,   weather_df = erahumed::albufera_weather )

title: INP: Input data — inp
text: model object class erahumed_model. outflows_df data.frame, whose structure follows template albufera_outflows; See details. weather_df data.frame, whose structure follows template albufera_weather; See details.

title: INP: Input data — inp
text: Objects class erahumed_model erahumed_inp, compute_inp() inp() respectively.

title: INP: Input data — inp
text: outflows_df input data.frame meant capture observational hydrological data Albufera lake. consists level column, daily measured lake water level meters, plus number columns named outflow_* (e.g. outflow_pujol), give daily measured outflows cube meters per second. weather_df captures relevant weather data modeling: Precipitation evapotranspiration, relevant modeling hydrological balance, corresponding precipitation_mm evapotranspiration_mm columns, respectively. Temperature, relevant affects chemical reaction speeds. data.frames date column (class Date), corresponding date domain interval (.e. missing data maximum minimum date allowed). subsequent modeling performed largest date interval hydrological weather input data available.

title: INP: Input data — inp
text: Valerio Gherardi

title: INP: Input data — inp
code: model <- erahumed_model() |> compute_inp() inp(model) #> An ERAHUMED INP model component. #>  #> Output columns: date, level, outflow_pujol, outflow_perellonet, outflow_perello, is_imputed_level, is_imputed_outflow, temperature_ave, temperature_min, temperature_max, precipitation_mm, evapotranspiration_mm

title: erahumed (development version)
text: Added ppm_to_kg_m3() ppm_to_g_cm3() internal helpers.

title: erahumed 0.8.1
text: Fixed various errors internal data-set providing physico-chemical parameters CT model layer. first effort address (#123), however requires review.

title: erahumed 0.8.1
text: CT component returns masses, also concentrations (water, sediment outflow densities). Density plots made available, Shiny interface well R API, new argument plot.ct_erahumed(variable).

title: erahumed 0.8.1
text: output CT model component now “long” format, chemical column, masses reported mf, mw ms columns.

title: erahumed 0.8.1
text: “Bare” references $output element model components internal code substituted, using component_output() extractor instead (#99).

title: erahumed 0.8.0
text: Nomenclature change: petp_df (argument compute_inp() well “parameter” INP component) becomes weather_df. Correspondingly, albufera_petp dataset renamed albufera_weather. changes come consequence #20 (see .)

title: erahumed 0.8.0
text: Data: added temperature daily data (minimum, maximum average) albufera_weather dataset (formerly known albufera_petp), closing #20. Introduced simplified temperature dependence algorithm CT model component (simply plug average daily temperature Arrhenius equation degradation constant). HBP: improved plotting method (plot.erahumed_hbp), now provides double plot cluster water levels (top) water flows (bottom). CA: added minimalistic Shiny interface display results chemical applications form time series individual clusters. CT: added plotting method (see ?plot.erahumed_ct) corresponding Shiny interface.

title: erahumed 0.7.3
text: CT: multiplier sediment water diffusion term thresholded one, number always positive fraction unity. case, multipliers larger one probably created issues pesticide parameters (e.g. unit errors) currently addressed, threshold become unnecessary long run.

title: erahumed 0.7.3
text: Renamed arguments compute_ct() making units explicit (e.g. css becomes css_ppm).

title: erahumed 0.7.3
text: Fixed inhomogeneous term evolution equation ms[t] (due typo ms wrongly getting added mass applied foliage).

title: erahumed 0.7.3
text: Re-enabled tests momentarily disabled refactor v0.6.0. consisted tests argument checking performed compute_hbp(), plus snapshot test (skipped CI) initial Shiny values. Various simplifications low-level code CT model components. Basic unit tests CT component functions.

title: erahumed 0.7.2
text: CT model component now uses actual cluster chemical parameters evolution equations (whereas previously using dummy values expected order magnitude).

title: erahumed 0.7.1
text: Fixes regression introduced v0.7.0 introduced error computation rain evaporation water volumes (see #115 #116).

title: erahumed 0.7.0
text: Experimental release CT model component, new functions compute_ct() ct() (close #92).

title: erahumed 0.7.0
text: Removed helpers linear_petp_surface() linear_storage_curve(). substituted simple lambdas specification defaults arguments compute_hba(), seems bit transparent (#96). compute_hba() argument name change: petp_surface becomes petp_function.

title: erahumed 0.7.0
text: Set amounts (kg_per_ha) albufera_ca_schedules builtin dataset (close #84).

title: erahumed 0.6.0
text: version provides important refactor software’s modeling interface, consolidating concept ERAHUMED model model components. refactor necessarily breaks existing code relied initial provisional interface. basic example illustrating use new modeling interface provided README update accompanies new version.

title: erahumed 0.6.0
text: Essential refactor modeling API, mentioned . HBP model component (formerly known “local hydrological balance”) allow anymore specification date_min/max arguments; date range univocally determined data fed INP model component. Removed bold printing methods, correctly rendering Github flavored markdown. Renamed HBP admissible plot types (value type parameter plot.erahumed_hbp()), "cluster_levels" "map" "cluster_view" "map_view". Removed height_thresh_cm argument arguments CA component high level functions (compute_ca() present version), move corresponding functions HBP component. ensures, particular, common value used across two different model components.

title: erahumed 0.5.1
text: Emails ORCID additional package authors added package metadata.

title: erahumed 0.5.1
text: Fix bug causing errors plots Perellonet, Perelló Pujol outflows Shiny interface (#90).

title: erahumed 0.5.1
text: package new website, available https://erahumed.github.io/erahumed/.

title: erahumed 0.5.0
text: Names columns representing outflows albufera_outflows prepended outflow_. Logic albufera_hb_global() improved way outflow columns automatically recognized input data.frame, need exactly "pujol", "perellonet" `"perello", . Former irrigation draining columns output data.frame albufera_hb_local() became ideal_irrigation ideal_draining, better reflect correspond originally scheduled irrigation draining plans. addition, new columns real_irrigation real_draining added data.frame, provide actual irrigation draining plans followed, modified plan delay.

title: erahumed 0.5.0
text: Visualizations “extra outflow” variable added global hydrological balance module Shiny dashboard.

title: erahumed 0.5.0
text: Fixed broken functionality ‘height_thresh_cm’ argument (#85). Correct bug causing wrong delay applied seed_day ca_choose_application_day_index() helper, building block ca().

title: erahumed 0.5.0
text: Unit testing CA model block (#77).

title: erahumed 0.4.1
text: First draft plot.erahumed_ca() (“cluster view”).

title: erahumed 0.4.1
text: default height_thresh_cm parameter ca() changed 2.5 2. albufera_management data-set new column seed_day, counts number day elapsed sowing day. also returned output data.frame albufera_hb_local(). erahumed_ca S3 class now inherits hb_local.

title: erahumed 0.4.1
text: Improvement data.frame validity checks. assert_data.frame() helper now able check column types. Noteworthy, allows much stricter tests "hb_local" "hb_global" functions. Important performance improvements function ca(). mainly achieved () removing validity checks low level function ca_to_cluster(), supplanted less costly checks level hb_local() output; (ii) bypassing computation using Date objects, thanks introduced seed_day column output albufera_hb_local() (see ).

title: erahumed 0.4.1
text: Improved documentation albufera_hb_global() default parameters.

title: erahumed 0.4.0
text: version introduces first draft new Chemicals Applications (CA) model block, meant simulate application chemicals (fertilizers pesticides), according previously obtained simulation local water levels water flows, output hydrological balance (HB) block. basic ca() function provided, takes input object S3 class "hb_local" (plus optional input parameters), returns similar data-frame, additional columns provide time series chemical applications. accompanying dataset albufera_ca_schedules provides schedules chemical applications Albufera lake, one customizable inputs ca().

title: erahumed 0.3.2
text: Shiny app continues work Albufera Leaflet map loaded reason. Added validation date range albufera_hb_local(). Tested exceptions raised albufera_hb_local()s argument validity checks. Documented plotting method hb_local hb_global S3 objects.

title: erahumed 0.3.2
text: Added Pablo Amador Andreu Rico package Authors@R.

title: erahumed 0.3.1
text: albufera_hb_local(), called default arguments, now retrieves value disk, data installed alongside erahumed. Due previous point, package’s .tar.gz file size much larger now, approximately 50MB. file size tackled, much possible, later releases. Added light print() summary() methods S3 objects returned albufera_hb_local() albufera_hb_global(). sf longer attached upon attaching erahumed.

title: erahumed 0.3.1
text: Package data prefixed everywhere code erahumed:: NAMESPACE, executing code without package attached lead errors. particular, calling erahumed::launch_app() without attaching erahumed longer lead error.

title: erahumed 0.3.1
text: Fixed R-CMD-check spurious NOTEs.

title: erahumed 0.3.0
text: New Shiny module set parameters hydrological balance calculations. New Shiny module modify input data algorithms.

title: erahumed 0.3.0
text: Added shinytest2 testing infrastructure, snapshot based tests developed later. Basic tests plotting utilities (succeed default arguments). Server testing hb_shiny.R modules, #15.

title: erahumed 0.2.2
text: Documentation albufera_hb_global() albufera_hb_local() wrappers. Exported hbg_residence_time() doc page. Former albufera_weather dataset becomes albufera_petp, structure significantly simplified, now three columns: date, rain_mm evapotranspiration_mm (previously named date, P ETP respectively). changes get propagated downstream tables, e.g. albufera_hb_global().

title: erahumed 0.2.2
text: previous versions algorithm, plan delays upon failing reach zero water levels given date applied ideal_height_cm vector. present version, draining irrigation plan also get delayed. observed give rise slightly natural water profiles (particular, delay accumulated summer often less 40 days, contrary used happen previous version).

title: erahumed 0.2.2
text: Add "hb_local" S3 class internal constructor (#21).

title: erahumed 0.2.1
text: Default arguments albufera_hb_global() albufera_hb_local() now prepended erahumed:: namespace specifier. Unexported residence_time()

title: erahumed 0.2.1
text: Separated logical units hb_global(), collected hb_global_units.R. Introduced argument checking hb_global() wrapper albufera_hb_global(). Introduced S3 class constructor "hb_global" class objects (see hb_global_units_s3_class.R). Important improvements testing infrastructure hb_global() andalbufera_hb_global(), algorithmic level (testing hb_global_units.R) level exceptions raised two functions.

title: erahumed 0.2.0
